title: What Trump’s win means for Ukraine, Middle East and China
byline: Donald Trump’s return to the White House is set to reshape US foreign policy, promising potentially radical shifts on multiple fronts as war and uncertainty grip parts of the world.

title: Uncertainty and challenges on the cards: Ruwan
byline: Uncertainty looms as Sri Lanka is to face unforeseen challenges as a group which tried to capture Parliament by force has entered the race to gain control of it, UNP General Secretary and Democratic Front candidate Ruwan Wijewardene said yesterday.

title: SLAF earns $130 Million through Peacekeeping missions
byline: Another contingent of the aviation unit, consisting of 20 officers and 88 airmen of the Sri Lanka Air Force, is scheduled to depart for the Central African Republic in the first week of December for peacekeeping missions.

title: Environmentalist attacked by Matale district election candidate
byline: Environmentalist Nadira Weerasinghe was reportedly assaulted by a candidate from the Matale district, according to police. The dispute was related to a tax agreement involving the management of Laggala Hotel, located at Riverston.

title: Five entities win BIA currency exchange counter bids worth Rs.2.3bn
byline: Five entities have won bids to operate currency exchange counters for a period of three years at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), Katunayake, with their total bid worth exceeding Rs.2.3 billion.

title: Trump claims victory after Fox News projects he has won US presidency
byline: Trump was first elected president in 2016, defeating former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton and vowing to ’’Make America Great Again.’’

title: Two new ambassadors present credentials to President
byline: Two newly appointed Ambassadors to Sri Lanka presented their credentials to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Presidential Secretariat today (07), President’s Media Division said.

title: Three arrested for illegal fishing obstructing shipping routes
byline: Three suspects were arrested for illegally fishing in a high-security sea area near the Port of Colombo, obstructing shipping routes.

title: Can't fulfil promises in five weeks: Vijitha
byline: Claiming that some opposition politicians are alleging that the government has failed to fulfil its promises, Minister Vijitha Herath said the manifesto of the National People’s Power (NPP) was presented to be completed within five years and not within five weeks.

title: Lohan,his wife further remanded
byline: Former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte and his wife Shashi Prabha Ratwatte were further remanded till November 18 over the case involving an unregistered luxury vehicle.

title: Bank accounts of cricketer Shakib Al Hasan seized
byline: Bangladesh Financial Intelligence Unit (BFIU) has seized all bank accounts of former national cricket team captain Shakib Al Hasan.

title: Sri Lanka awarded ’’Most Desirable Island in the World
byline: Sri Lanka has been voted as the ’’Most Desirable Island in the World’’ according to the results for the 23rd Annual Wanderlust Reader Travel Awards.

title: Australia moves to ban children under 16 from social media
byline: Australia’s prime minister on Thursday vowed to ban children under 16 from social media, saying the pervasive influence of platforms like Facebook and TikTok was ’’doing real harm to our kids’’.
